body: Hi @dwickern, thanks for the report. Would you mind checking if there are any `OpenOption`s that we can pass to `newOutputStream` that might solve the problem. E.g. perhaps `Files.newOutputStream(pid.toPath, APPEND)` would work for the special `NUL` file, rather than the default of `CREATE, TRUNCATE_EXISTING, WRITE`.
Indeed, it works using `APPEND`. It also works with `CREATE+WRITE` but fails if `TRUNCATE_EXISTING` is included.

Thanks for checking. I'll change it to use `APPEND`. Below is the code that I'll change the PID writing code to. I'm pretty sure the `out.write(bytes)` and `out.close` calls will work OK with APPEND but perhaps you could check that too, just in case?

```scala
val pid = "test-pid"
val out = java.nio.file.Files.newOutputStream(pidFile.toPath, APPEND)
try out.write(pid.getBytes) finally out.close()
```
LGTM adding the `APPEND` argument. The code already checked that the file doesn't exist so the TRUNCATE was unnecessary in this case

well I stumbled upon that a few days ago as well and posted it in gitter:
https://gitter.im/playframework/contributors?at=596c813a3230e14f3a67c56d

actually I didn't had time for creating documentation for it, but I think it's enough to just include a warning that `-Dpidfile.path="/dev/null"` works for all supported systems including windows. 
I mean we never documented the `-Dpidfile.path="NUL"` workaround in windows.

Good tip! I've got a Windows VM downloaded now so I can test this out. I'm not sure about using `APPEND` since that means there's a race condition creating the file. I like the look of `CREATE_NEW` since that is apparently atomic. [(See here.)](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/nio/file/Files.html#newByteChannel-java.nio.file.Path-java.util.Set-java.nio.file.attribute.FileAttribute...-)

The current code also has a race condition... often the case when you see `file.exists()`. You can use `CREATE_NEW` and catch `FileAlreadyExistsException` to determine if the pidfile exists. That should also work for NUL on Windows.

`-Dpidfile.path=NUL` wasn't documented but there's at least some information out there:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15088751/play-2-0-starting-as-windows-service-after-server-restart/17391176#17391176
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/play-framework/4amD9o37Ki4

Thanks for checking that `CREATE_NEW` works works for `NUL` on Windows.

> The current code also has a race condition...

I guess that's because the current code is using `CREATE` instead of `CREATE_NEW`. I think this bit of code needs a unit test at least to ensure we're getting the expected behaviour!

@dwickern well I just think that it's better to use `-Dpidfile.path=/dev/null` on both systems, because you don't need seperate vm configurations then ;)
I think why it worked is, because the old way would go trough a windows api where NUL meant something like `/dev/null`.

issue.title: Use CREATE_NEW for PID file creation

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Fixes #7646.

1. This allows the PID file to be set to the `nul` special file in Windows. (Thanks @dwickern for verifying this.)
2. This fixes a race condition when starting the server. Using CREATE_NEW ensures the PID file is created atomically by only one server.
